meanings.sent1: The council will ratify the decision at the next meeting.
meanings.sent2: The government will ratify the treaty to make it official.
meanings.sent3: The mayor will ratify the new law with a big stamp.
meanings.sent4: Her signature on the contract will ratify the agreement.
meanings.sent5: The judge's signature will ratify the court order.

meanings.definition: To make something officially valid or effective
meanings.sent1: The board will ratify the new policy to ensure its legality.
meanings.sent2: The company will ratify the contract to put it into effect.
meanings.sent3: The magician will ratify his magic trick with a wave of his wand.
meanings.sent4: The key will ratify the access code to unlock the door.
meanings.sent5: The stamp will ratify the document as authentic.
